bwwExcerpt: Admittedly, it's not easy to cram 50-plus years of performance and personal details into a two-and-a-half-hour spectacle with a couple of dozen songs to cover, but does it have to feel so much like a Wikipedia entry with karaoke breaks? Director Jason Moore (Shrek) plays traffic cop well enough, but Daryl Waters' synthetic orchestrations and arrangements don't differentiate the songs' periods or styles very much.
